attributes.action: scrap the existing rules regarding sitting Members of Parliament expenses which evidence shows are utterly unbreakable - regardless of the level of abuse applied by honourable members - to one where honourable members are required to outlay the expense first, then reclaim the amount outlaid.  All such reclaimed expenses should then be subject to annual audit by HMRC and NAO, to ensure probity.  Honourable members have demonstrated recently that they CANNOT be trusted to police themselves when it comes to matters of money - especially when it is other people's money!
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: To take tax free allowances for expenses which are not actually incurred is fraud. Honourable members need to be subject to the same rules as we distinctly more honourable taxpayers.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
